record.title: MEASURES READ THE FIRST TIME--S. 2264 AND H.R. 2295 EN BLOC
record.narrative:
MEASURES READ THE FIRST TIME--S. 2264 AND H.R. 2295 EN BLOC -- (Senate - October 30, 2007)

[Page: S13588]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I understand that two bills are at the desk. I ask for their first reading en bloc.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered. The clerk will report.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (S. 2264) a bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend for two years the tax-free distributions from individual retirement plans for charitable purposes.
A resolution (H.R. 2295) to amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the establishment of an Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Registry.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for a second reading, and in order to place the bills on the calendar under the provisions of rule XIV, I object to my own request en bloc.

record.chair: Objection is heard. The bills will be read for the second time on the next legislative day.
